quests.name: The Frozen Throne
quests.description: The Frostpeak Mountains are in turmoil. The ancient dwarven fortress of Khar-Zadul has begun emitting waves of supernatural cold, the Crystal Ice Caverns have sealed themselves shut, and the dragon Frostfang has become increasingly aggressive. Ranger Captain Svala in Snowhaven believes the disturbances are connected and needs capable adventurers to investigate before the entire mountain range becomes uninhabitable.
quests.journal: Ranger Captain Svala has asked us to investigate the disturbances in the Frostpeak Mountains. We must explore the Crystal Ice Caverns, uncover the truth about Khar-Zadul's Frozen King, and ultimately confront the elder dragon Frostfang at the summit.

objectives.description: Speak with the dwarven elders in Ironhearth about the fortress Khar-Zadul
objectives.journal: The dwarves of Ironhearth may know the history of the sealed fortress. We should speak with Forgemaster Durin.

objectives.description: Clear the Crystal Ice Caverns and defeat the Crystal Golem
objectives.journal: The Crystal Ice Caverns hold the first clue. Something ancient stirs in the deepest chamber.

objectives.description: Return to Forgemaster Durin with the Prismatic Crystal Core
objectives.journal: The Crystal Core we found may reveal the nature of the corruption. Durin can analyze it.

objectives.description: Enter Khar-Zadul and confront the Frozen King
objectives.journal: The Frozen King sits on his ice throne, bound by a cursed crown. We must free him — or destroy him.

objectives.description: Claim the Frozen King's runehammer
objectives.journal: The Frozen King's runehammer was forged to slay Frostfang. We will need it for what comes next.

objectives.description: Ascend to Frostfang Summit and defeat the Elder Dragon
objectives.journal: The summit awaits. Frostfang the Elder Dragon must be stopped before the mountains themselves are destroyed.

objectives.description: Return to Ranger Captain Svala with news of your victory
objectives.journal: Frostfang is defeated. We should inform Svala and the people of the mountains.

quests.name: The Last Patrol
quests.description: Ranger Halvar's patrol team went missing three days ago in the Whitecap Pass. The blizzard conditions have worsened, and no one else is willing to brave the storm. Halvar asks you to find his missing rangers — or at least bring back their badges so their families can have closure.
quests.journal: Three rangers are missing in the Whitecap Pass. We must brave the blizzard to find them.

objectives.description: Search the Whitecap Pass for the missing rangers
objectives.journal: Follow the marked trail into the Whitecap Pass. Look for signs of the patrol camp.

objectives.description: Find the rangers' camp and investigate
objectives.journal: The camp has been found — torn apart by something large. Blood in the snow leads deeper into the pass.

objectives.description: Follow the blood trail to the yeti den
objectives.journal: The trail leads to a yeti den. The rangers may still be alive inside.

objectives.description: Rescue the rangers or recover their badges

options.description: Defeat the yetis and free all three rangers (they are alive but injured)
Two rangers are alive, one has succumbed to wounds. Recover the fallen's badge.
Discover the yeti matriarch is protecting cubs. Negotiate a peaceful withdrawal with the injured rangers.

objectives.journal: The situation in the den is more complex than expected.

objectives.description: Return to Ranger Halvar
objectives.journal: Report back to Halvar with news of his patrol.

branchCondition.note: Whether all rangers survive depends on how quickly the player reaches the den. Taking more than 3 in-game days means one ranger dies from injuries.

quests.name: Ghosts of Khar-Zadul
quests.description: Forgemaster Durin confides that his ancestors were among those trapped when Khar-Zadul froze. He asks you to recover the Ledger of Grudges from the fortress's great hall — a sacred dwarven record of debts owed and wrongs to be righted. With it, he can perform the Rite of Release and free the dwarven ghosts from their eternal patrol.
quests.journal: Durin wants us to find the Ledger of Grudges in Khar-Zadul so the dwarven ghosts can finally rest.

objectives.description: Enter Khar-Zadul and locate the Great Hall
objectives.journal: The Great Hall of Khar-Zadul lies on the second level of the fortress.

objectives.description: Find the Ledger of Grudges
objectives.journal: The Ledger is kept in the Recordkeeper's alcove behind the High Table.

objectives.description: Decide the fate of the Ledger

options.description: Return the Ledger to Durin for the Rite of Release
Read the Ledger first — discover it contains the location of a hidden dwarven treasure vault
Give the Ledger to the Ghost Captain in Khar-Zadul, allowing the ghosts to settle their own grudges

objectives.journal: We have the Ledger. Now we must decide what to do with it.

objectives.description: Witness the outcome of your choice
objectives.journal: The dwarven spirits await.

quests.name: The Avalanche Express
quests.description: Caravan Master Yoldi needs a vital shipment of medicine delivered to Ironhearth before the mountain passes close for winter. The direct route has been blocked by an avalanche, and the detour through Goat Berserker territory is nearly as dangerous. She offers generous pay for escorts who can get the medicine through.
quests.journal: Escort the medicine caravan to Ironhearth through dangerous mountain passes.

objectives.description: Meet the caravan at the Snowhaven gates
objectives.journal: The caravan departs at dawn from the south gate.

objectives.description: Choose a route to Ironhearth

options.description: Take the Goat Pass — shorter but infested with Mountain Goat Berserkers
Cross the Ice Bridge — longer but avoids most enemies. Risk of bridge collapse.
Use the abandoned mine tunnels — dark and cramped, but sheltered from weather. Unknown dangers below.

objectives.journal: Three routes to Ironhearth. Each carries its own dangers.

objectives.description: Navigate the chosen route and protect the caravan
objectives.journal: Keep the caravan intact. If the medicine is destroyed, the mission fails.

objectives.description: Deliver the medicine to Ironhearth
objectives.journal: Get the caravan to Ironhearth's gates in one piece.

quests.name: The Dragon Scale Cloak
quests.description: The legendary weaver Astrid has spent decades perfecting the art of working dragon scales into fabric. She believes a cloak made from Frostfang's shed scales would provide unparalleled protection against extreme cold — and she has a buyer in the Scorched Wastes willing to pay a king's ransom. She needs you to collect 5 Frostfang Scales from the dragon's territory. The scales shed naturally and can be found lodged in ice near the summit, but collecting them means traversing the most dangerous part of the mountain.
quests.journal: Collect 5 Frostfang Scales from the summit approach for Weaver Astrid.

objectives.description: Collect 5 Frostfang Scales from the summit approach
objectives.journal: The scales are lodged in ice formations along the summit approach path.

objectives.description: Return the scales to Weaver Astrid
objectives.journal: We have the scales. Time to deliver them to Astrid.

optionalObjectives.description: Collect 3 additional scales for Astrid to make a second cloak — for you

quests.name: Forgemaster Durin's Legacy
quests.description: After the events in Khar-Zadul, Forgemaster Durin reveals that he is the last living descendant of the Frozen King. He asks to accompany the party to the deepest forge of Khar-Zadul, where his ancestor's masterwork — a suit of armor called the Ironmantle — lies unfinished. Durin wishes to complete his ancestor's work and wear the armor as a symbol of the dwarven people's endurance. But the forge is guarded by the most powerful ghosts in the fortress, and they will not relinquish their king's treasure willingly.
quests.journal: Accompany Forgemaster Durin to the deepest forge of Khar-Zadul to complete his ancestor's masterwork armor.

objectives.description: Escort Durin to the Deep Forge of Khar-Zadul
objectives.journal: The Deep Forge is below the throne room, through the Royal Armory.

objectives.description: Defend Durin while he works the forge
objectives.journal: Ghost guardians attack in waves while Durin works. We must protect him.

objectives.description: Witness the completion of the Ironmantle
objectives.journal: The Ironmantle is complete. Durin takes his place as the true heir of Khar-Zadul.

quests.name: Bounty: The White Death
quests.description: A bounty has been posted for an enormous albino yeti known as 'The White Death' that has been terrorizing the mountain passes. Multiple caravans have been destroyed, and the beast seems to be growing bolder with each attack.
quests.journal: Hunt down and slay the White Death, an alpha yeti terrorizing the mountain passes.

objectives.description: Track the White Death through the mountain passes
objectives.journal: Follow the trail of massive tracks and destroyed caravans to find the alpha yeti's territory.

objectives.description: Defeat the White Death
objectives.journal: The White Death is an alpha yeti of immense size and ferocity. Be prepared.

objectives.description: Collect the White Death's fang as proof
objectives.journal: Take a fang from the slain beast as proof of the kill.

objectives.description: Turn in the bounty at Snowhaven
objectives.journal: Return to the Snowhaven bounty board to claim the reward.

durin-saga.name: The Legacy of Khar-Zadul
durin-saga.note: Completing Forgemaster Durin's Legacy unlocks Durin as a companion.
